verses.verse: I will stand <S%H5975><s%> upon my watch <S%H4931><s%>, and set <S%H3320><s%> me upon the tower <S%H4692><s%>, and will watch <S%H6822><s%> to see <S%H7200><s%> what he will say <S%H1696><s%> unto me, and what I shall answer <S%H7725><s%> when I am reproved <S%H8433><s%>.

And the LORD <S%H3068><s%> answered <S%H6030><s%> me, and said <S%H559><s%>, Write <S%H3789><s%> the vision <S%H2377><s%>, and make it plain <S%H874><s%> upon tables <S%H3871><s%>, that he may run <S%H7323><s%> that readeth <S%H7121><s%> it.

For the vision <S%H2377><s%> is yet for an appointed time <S%H4150><s%>, but at the end <S%H7093><s%> it shall speak <S%H6315><s%>, and not lie <S%H3576><s%>: though it tarry <S%H4102><s%>, wait <S%H2442><s%> for it; because it will surely <S%H935><s%> come <S%H935><s%>, it will not tarry <S%H309><s%>.
Behold, his soul <S%H5315><s%> which is lifted up <S%H6075><s%> is not upright <S%H3474><s%> in him: but the just <S%H6662><s%> shall live <S%H2421><s%> by his faith <S%H530><s%>.

¶ Yea also, because he transgresseth <S%H898><s%> by wine <S%H3196><s%>, he is a proud <S%H3093><s%> man <S%H1397><s%>, neither keepeth at home <S%H5115><s%>, who enlargeth <S%H7337><s%> his desire <S%H5315><s%> as hell <S%H7585><s%>, and is as death <S%H4194><s%>, and cannot be satisfied <S%H7646><s%>, but gathereth <S%H622><s%> unto him all nations <S%H1471><s%>, and heapeth <S%H6908><s%> unto him all people <S%H5971><s%>:

Shall not all these take up <S%H5375><s%> a parable <S%H4912><s%> against him, and a taunting <S%H4426><s%> proverb <S%H2420><s%> against him, and say <S%H559><s%>, Woe <S%H1945><s%> to him that increaseth <S%H7235><s%> that which is not his! how long? and to him that ladeth <S%H3513><s%> himself with thick clay <S%H5671><s%>!

Shall they not rise up <S%H6965><s%> suddenly <S%H6621><s%> that shall bite <S%H5391><s%> thee, and awake <S%H3364><s%> that shall vex <S%H2111><s%> thee, and thou shalt be for booties <S%H4933><s%> unto them?

Because thou hast spoiled <S%H7997><s%> many <S%H7227><s%> nations <S%H1471><s%>, all the remnant <S%H3499><s%> of the people <S%H5971><s%> shall spoil <S%H7997><s%> thee; because of men's <S%H120><s%> blood <S%H1818><s%>, and for the violence <S%H2555><s%> of the land <S%H776><s%>, of the city <S%H7151><s%>, and of all that dwell <S%H3427><s%> therein.

¶ Woe <S%H1945><s%> to him that coveteth <S%H1214><s%> an evil <S%H7451><s%> covetousness <S%H1215><s%> to his house <S%H1004><s%>, that he may set <S%H7760><s%> his nest <S%H7064><s%> on high <S%H4791><s%>, that he may be delivered <S%H5337><s%> from the power <S%H3709><s%> of evil <S%H7451><s%>!

Thou hast consulted <S%H3289><s%> shame <S%H1322><s%> to thy house <S%H1004><s%> by cutting off <S%H7096><s%> many <S%H7227><s%> people <S%H5971><s%>, and hast sinned <S%H2398><s%> against thy soul <S%H5315><s%>.
For the stone <S%H68><s%> shall cry out <S%H2199><s%> of the wall <S%H7023><s%>, and the beam out <S%H3714><s%> of the timber <S%H6086><s%> shall answer <S%H6030><s%> it.
¶ Woe <S%H1945><s%> to him that buildeth <S%H1129><s%> a town <S%H5892><s%> with blood <S%H1818><s%>, and stablisheth <S%H3559><s%> a city <S%H7151><s%> by iniquity <S%H5766><s%>!

Behold, is it not of the LORD <S%H3068><s%> of hosts <S%H6635><s%> that the people <S%H5971><s%> shall labour <S%H3021><s%> in the very <S%H1767><s%> fire <S%H784><s%>, and the people <S%H3816><s%> shall weary <S%H3286><s%> themselves for very <S%H1767><s%> vanity <S%H7385><s%>?

For the earth <S%H776><s%> shall be filled <S%H4390><s%> with the knowledge <S%H3045><s%> of the glory <S%H3519><s%> of the LORD <S%H3068><s%>, as the waters <S%H4325><s%> cover <S%H3680><s%> the sea <S%H3220><s%>.

¶ Woe <S%H1945><s%> unto him that giveth his neighbour <S%H7453><s%> drink <S%H8248><s%>, that puttest <S%H5596><s%> thy bottle <S%H2573><s%> to him, and makest him drunken <S%H7937><s%> also, that thou mayest look <S%H5027><s%> on their nakedness <S%H4589><s%>!

Thou art filled <S%H7646><s%> with shame <S%H7036><s%> for glory <S%H3519><s%>: drink <S%H8354><s%> thou also, and let thy foreskin be uncovered <S%H6188><s%>: the cup <S%H3563><s%> of the LORD's <S%H3068><s%> right hand <S%H3225><s%> shall be turned <S%H5437><s%> unto thee, and shameful spewing <S%H7022><s%> shall be on thy glory <S%H3519><s%>.

For the violence <S%H2555><s%> of Lebanon <S%H3844><s%> shall cover <S%H3680><s%> thee, and the spoil <S%H7701><s%> of beasts <S%H929><s%>, which made them afraid <S%H2865><s%>, because of men's <S%H120><s%> blood <S%H1818><s%>, and for the violence <S%H2555><s%> of the land <S%H776><s%>, of the city <S%H7151><s%>, and of all that dwell <S%H3427><s%> therein.

¶ What profiteth <S%H3276><s%> the graven image <S%H6459><s%> that the maker <S%H3335><s%> thereof hath graven <S%H6458><s%> it; the molten image <S%H4541><s%>, and a teacher <S%H3384><s%> of lies <S%H8267><s%>, that the maker <S%H3335><s%> of his work <S%H3336><s%> trusteth <S%H982><s%> therein, to make <S%H6213><s%> dumb <S%H483><s%> idols <S%H457><s%>?

Woe <S%H1945><s%> unto him that saith <S%H559><s%> to the wood <S%H6086><s%>, Awake <S%H6974><s%>; to the dumb <S%H1748><s%> stone <S%H68><s%>, Arise <S%H5782><s%>, it shall teach <S%H3384><s%>! Behold, it is laid <S%H8610><s%> over with gold <S%H2091><s%> and silver <S%H3701><s%>, and there is no breath <S%H7307><s%> at all in the midst <S%H7130><s%> of it.
But the LORD <S%H3068><s%> is in his holy <S%H6944><s%> temple <S%H1964><s%>: let all the earth <S%H776><s%> keep silence <S%H2013><s%> before <S%H6440><s%> him.
